Comment: Web guy here. Typically there are file size limits on uploads for security and storage reasons. Same with file types. Fixing the size issue for users wouldn’t be good for the server/company.   That said, the only thing to do is what you did. Pare down the file to the essentials in the right format and you’re golden.   They’ll get the message in your case. And since they likely wouldn’t read more than the title or file name your point will be well made.   I’d suggest naming the file in a way that makes your point in case they don’t open it. If they skip the file name make sure the title page is in large print.   Footnote: some sites allow compressed files but in my experience that extra step of unpacking it is skipped as are the contents.   A simple .docx or pdf file with a simple message would get the point across. Hell, you could even create a Nazi resume and use that. Also, I hate that autocorrect caps the word nazi unless is prevent it.
